description: Students in this course learn and apply economic analysis, tempered by an appreciation for
the political and institutional contexts of the less developed countries, to gain an
understanding of these countries' economies. Using cases involving both written and oral
analysis, students explore topics such as economic growth in Brazil, trade strategies in
Singapore, poverty and income distribution in Taiwan, or macroeconomic performance in Mexico.
Prerequisite: one of Economics 110-122 or permission of instructor.
